paperparcel

Interface TypeAdapter<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - The Type to override the default reading/writing functionality for

    public interface TypeAdapter<T>

    A custom method for reading and writing a type using Parcel.

    When defining a TypeAdapter, you may choose to handle null values or not. If you choose not to, PaperParcel will handle the null-safety for you automatically. If you choose to handle null values (or the adapted type can never be null), then you should set Adapter.nullSafe() to true.

    See Also:
    Adapter.nullSafe()

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      T readFromParcel(android.os.Parcel source)
      Creates a new instance of the desired Type by reading values from the Parcel inParcel
      void writeToParcel(T value, android.os.Parcel dest, int flags)
      Writes value to the Parcel outParcel.

    • Method Detail

      • readFromParcel

        T readFromParcel(@NonNull
                 android.os.Parcel source)
        Creates a new instance of the desired Type by reading values from the Parcel inParcel
        Parameters:
        source - The Parcel which contains the values of T
        Returns:
        A new object based on the values in inParcel.

      • writeToParcel

        void writeToParcel(T value,
                   @NonNull
                   android.os.Parcel dest,
                   int flags)
        Writes value to the Parcel outParcel.
        Parameters:
        value - The object to be written to the Parcel
        dest - The Parcel which will contain the value of T
        flags - Additional flags about how the object should be written. May be 0 or Parcelable.PARCELABLE_WRITE_RETURN_VALUE.
